pageContext.desc: Family life, farming, and trips to Chicago.

pages.transcription:
January 1st 1851
Mr Bristol and Mip Misner came to see us had a very pleasant visit with them they brought some books for presents for the girls
Feb 5 Donation party at our house for Mary Gudson
Feb 17 little Marietta swallowed a pin spent a night of intense anxiety
21st pin found no more trouble about that

1851
March 9th Heard the terrible news of Aldrie's death which occured three months ago according to the report in the paper, but we could not beleive it as the name reported was Albert, we thought it must be some one else until letters from California confirmed it
O  what dreadful days and weeks of suspense and agony no one knows but those that have passed through the same trial

1851
March 31

Mr Hummell moved in the house with us to carry on the farm on shares

Apr 13 Oscar and Lucy came out to see us

Text for A funeral
Sermon Heb 11 & 10 th
He looked for a city which hath foundations whose builder and maker is God
Hymns sung
Why do w mourn departed friends
And must this body die
Unveil thy bosom faithfu tomb

Aunt Clara moved to Shelburn Apr 1st 1862
Harrison wife died
May 1862

pageContext.title: Rowley family diary, 1851
